column4: when you install things using sudo, why do they not appear on the desktop?
why would an app/package installed auto-apear on your desktop?
thats not the usual behaviour - installing means installing ..not creating aliases or similar to your desktop
I am used to windows, thats all

creating desktop-shortcuts is - if done at all usualy a bonbon/add-on after finishing the real install. in linux its usualy on you to do so - especialy as some desktop-environment try to keep your desktop free/uncluttered
give those launchers a chance - there are several ways/apps to start apps by name just bypressing a shortcut and entering a few letters.
could you pastebin us the output of your apt-command? maybe we can explain if there was some error output
there was no error at all in your paste ;)
so basically - your paste shows how it fetched the data of that specific package - unpacked it and did the core-setup
what do you mean by 'search function'?
guess you mean the unity dash right?
yes the portal looking icon with a round white circle
tried starting it from cli? not using that package here - nor am i using unity - so i cant doublecheck if it act similar here.
while: apt-cache search SEARCHSTRING  << will search the package informations for your SEARCHSTRING
apt is acutaly pretty lovely if you get used to the basic commands;)
you can for sure us some kind of software-center or apt-gui as well - but it will help you to udnerstand the basics of apt and cli-usage
try to rephrase your problem - what do you mean by 'wine stopped installing' and did you see/get any error output?
